sen.j: 元明天皇の御世に従五位下へと叙せられ（和銅6年1月23日 (旧暦)）、その後聖武天皇の御世になって従五位上へと昇進し（天平元年3月4日 (旧暦)）、下野国守に任ぜられた（同4年10月17日 (旧暦)）。
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Genmei, he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 23, 713; during the reign of Emperor Shomu, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) on March 4, 729 and appointed to Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governer of Shimotsuke Province) on October 17, 732.

During the reign of Emperor Genmei, he was appointed to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 23, 713 on the old calendar; during the reign of Emperor Shomu, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) on March 4, 729 on the old calendar and appointed to Shimotsuke no kuni no kami (the governer of Shimotsuke Province) on October 17, 732 on the old calendar.

sen.j: 同時代の一族に、藤原不比等等と大宝律令の選定に関与し、また数少ない古代文書の一である伊吉博徳『伊吉博徳書』を残したことでも知られる伊吉博徳がいる。
sen.e: His clan of the same age included IKI no Hakatoko, who engaged in issuing Taiho Ritsuryo (Taiho Code), together with FUJIWARA no Fuhito and so forth, and wrote "Document by IKI no Hatatoku", one of the few ancient documents.

sen.j: 続日本紀には、古麻呂がまだ従八位下であった慶雲4年5月15日 (旧暦)（707年6月23日）に、古麻呂が隔絶の地への使者として赴いたため、文武天皇より巨勢邑治と一緒に綿、麻布、鍬および籾を賜ったとある。
sen.e: According to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Komaro, together with Kose no Oji, was given cotton, hemp, a hoe and unhulled rice by Emperor Monmu because Komaro, whose rank was Juhachiinoge (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade), went to an isolated place as an Emperor's envoy.

According to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Komaro, together with Kose no Oji, was given cotton, hemp, a hoe and hulled rice by Emperor Monmu because Komaro, whose rank was still Juhachiinoge (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade), went to an isolated place as an Emperor's envoy on June 23, 707.
sen.cmt: ・「まだ」という意味がなかったので追加しました。・年号が抜けていたので追加しました。・「籾」はまだ籾殻が付いている米ということなのでhulled riceとなるかと思われます。
sen.e: According to "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), Komaro, together with Kose no Oji, was given cotton, hemp, a hoe and hulled rice by Emperor Monmu because Komaro, whose rank was still Juhachiinoge (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade), went to an isolated place as an Emperor's envoy on June 23, 707.

sen.j: 同じく同書には巨勢邑治等は遣唐使として同年3月2日 (旧暦)（707年4月12日）に唐より帰国したとあるので、古麻呂もこれに同行したものと考えられるが不詳である。
sen.e: "Shoku Nihongi"also said that Kose no Oji and others, who had visited Tang Dynasty China as Japanese envoys, came back to Japan on April 12, 707; it is not clear but Komaro might have been to Tang with them.
